name: 4-nhac-2266-tetrame-piperidin-n-oxide
Reason: 4-Nhac-2266-tetrame-piperidin-n-oxide has a complex structure with multiple functional groups, which will impact its melting point. Starting with the base of piperidine, which has a melting point of approximately 100°C. The presence of four methoxy groups (–O–) will increase the melting point due to the additional molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C each. The piperidine ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +10°C. The tetramethylene chain (–C(=O)–C(=O)–) adds to the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C. The nitro group (–NO2) can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +10°C. Finally, the oxide group (–O–) can contribute to the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C.
